Introduction

This project presents a novel approach that integrates the Karush-Kuhn-Tucker (KKT) conditions with Ordinary Differential Equations (ODEs) and combines this methodology with Deep Learning techniques. The objective is to solve optimization problems with constraints more efficiently by leveraging the strengths of both analytical and computational methods.

next

Workflow

STEP 1 
Build a Linea​r
 Programming Problem

STEP 2
Convert LP problem into KKT condition

STEP 3 
Turn  KKT condition into ODEs

STEP 4
Input ODEs into Deep learning

Result

next

Performance

In general, ODEs approached by neural network has higher error rate than SLSQP (a method often use for solving LP problem), but it costs much less time than SLSQP.

Compare the performance of ODEs approached by a neural network with SLSQP in obtaining the optimal solution for an LP problem.

0.004

margin of error for average optimal solution

0.0289

margin of error for average objective function

4850%

much faster than SLSQP
.
